member.name: T:MBSLibrary.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:MBSLibrary.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:MBSLibrary.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:MBSLibrary.ISoundEx
member.summary: Abstract base class for all SoundEx implementations Could also be used for other phonetic matching algorithms such as "Metaphone"/"Metaphon".

member.name: M:MBSLibrary.ISoundEx.Difference(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Implements the Difference algorithm, as found in SQL Server
member.returns: 0-4 depending on the similarity of the two words

member.name: M:MBSLibrary.ISoundEx.EncodeChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Marked as virtual so that concrete ISoundEx implementations can replace this and add extra characters for encoding. For example, the Online Dictionary of Computings specifies several extra characters in the lookup table.

member.name: T:MBSLibrary.SQLServerSoundEx
member.summary:
SQL Server only ignores adjacent duplicated phonetic sounds Plus, it doesn't ignore a character if it is duplicated with the leading char
For example, SQL Server will encode "PPPP" as "P100", whereas Miracode will encode it as "P000".
